p: Compared to other stresses, few data are available about the cross-protection between antimicrobial adaptation and acid stress resistance in L. monocytogenes. Ethanol alone, ethanol plus citral or (E)-2-hexenal increased the ability of L. monocytogenes Scott A to survive and grow at pH 4.5. Interestingly, treatment with thyme EO reduced the acid stress resistance of L. monocytogenes Scott A also under the food-like system. The different acid resistance induced by antimicrobials could be related to the proteome plasticity of L. monocytogenes that improve the cell survival to specific environmental conditions.
